metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000665 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.Description:
Dojo Dojo Objective Harness (DOH) version prior to version 1.14 contains aCross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in unit.html andtestsDOH/_base/loader/i18n-exhaustive/i18n-test/unit.html andtestsDOH/_base/i18nExhaustive.js in the DOH that can result in Victimattacked through their browser - deliver malware, steal HTTP cookies,bypass CORS trust. This attack appear to be exploitable via Victims aretypically lured to a web site under the attacker's control; the XSSvulnerability on the target domain is silently exploited without thevictim's knowledge. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.14.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-dojo-core - 1.17.2+dfsg1-2
libjs-dojo-dijit - 1.17.2+dfsg1-2
libjs-dojo-dojox - 1.17.2+dfsg1-2
shrinksafe - 1.17.2+dfsg1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dojo package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17.2+dfsg1-2').
